item.title: NINJA GAIDEN II Black ‘New Game+’ and ‘Photo Mode’ update now available
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/ninja-gaiden-ii-black-new-game-and-photo-mode-update-now-available

  • PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Plus you can now hide your projectile weapon.

Publisher Koei Tecmo and developer Team NINJA have released a new update for NINJA GAIDEN II Black, which adds a “New Game+” option and “Photo Mode,” as well as the ability to hide your projectile weapon while it is carried on your back.

Get the details below.

Additional Content

  • New Game+ – Added the ability to begin a new game on a difficulty level you have previously cleared with the weapons and Ninpo you obtained in your previous playthrough already unlocked. When starting a new game this way, your weapons and Ninpo will be reverted to level 1.
  • Photo Mode – Added Photo Mode to the in-game Options Menu. You can move the camera around within a set limit to take screenshots.
  • Ability to Hide Projectile Weapon – Added a “Show Projectile Weapon” option under “Game Settings” in the Options Menu, which allows you to hide your projectile weapon while it is carried on your back.

Adjustments

  • Lowered the HP of enemies in Ch. 8, “City of the Fallen Goddess.”
  • Lowered the HP of enemies in Ch. 11, “Night in the City of Water.”
  • Raised the number of enemies in Ch. 13, “The Temple of Sacrifice.”
  • Raised the number of enemies in Ch. 14, “A Tempered Gravestone.”
  • Raised the damage dealt by some of Ayane’s attacks.

Bug Fixes

  • Fixed control issues that occurred when playing at over 120 frames per second or while under high computing load.
  • Fixed an issue where controllers would not vibrate based on computing load or frames per second settings.
  • Fixed bugs that caused the player to go out of bounds during certain chapters.
  • Fixed bugs that made it impossible to progress during certain chapters.
  • Fixed a bug which caused the game to crash during long play sessions.
  • Other minor bug fixes.

NINJA GAIDEN II Black is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam and Microsoft Store. It is also available via Game Pass.

item.title: One Piece: Pirate Warriors 4 coming to PS5, Xbox Series; shipments and digital sales top four million
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/one-piece-pirate-warriors-4-coming-to-ps5-xbox-series-shipments-and-digital-sales-top-four-million

  • PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

New downloadable content also planned.

Publisher Bandai Namco and developer Omega Force will release PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series versions of One Piece: Pirate Warriors 4, the companies announced. A release date was not announced.

The PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series versions of One Piece: Pirate Warriors 4 will include every downloadable content character and mission released thus far. New downloadable content is also planned, with additional characters to be determined by user survey. The survey is available now in English and Japanese.

The companies also announced that total shipments and digital sales for One Piece: Pirate Warriors 4 have surpassed four million units since its launch across PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam on March 26, 2020.
